Posts.Content: lynnt wrote: Hi, I have developed what my oncologist is calling a fat necrosis on my reconstructed breast. The area was painful off and on. When I felt my breast at the pain's source last week, I felt a dreaded lump. Freaked out, of course. Saw my doctor today and she is saying that it is most likely a fat necrosis. I will be having an ultrasound done soon. Have any of you had this problem? If so, has the necrosis eventually dissipated or does it just stay there? Thanks! Lynn Dx 10/7/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 11/8/2009 Mastectomy: Left, Right Chemotherapy 1/20/2010 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 5/4/2010 Radiation Therapy 9/24/2010 Breast Surgery 10/24/2011 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 2/20/2013 Reconstruction (left): Nipple reconstruction, TUG flap; Reconstruction (right): Nipple reconstruction, TUG flap Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Fat Necrosis after Reconstruction lynnt Jennt28
